page.title: 05All Saints, Church, Clive.
page.content: The Parish Church of Clive is built from Grinshill sandstone and was erected in 1885-1887, the spire being added in 1892. There was a church on the site however in the days of the first Domesday Book in 1086 and part of this old building can be seen at the south wall. The tower contains a peal of six bells, whilst inside there is much carved woodwork in the pulpit, pews and screen. The font has a wrought iron canopy and the altar is a marble slab on carved wood. The organ was made by Henry Willis in 1887. The present vicar of the church is the Rev. W.E. Ward and services are held once a week on Sundays. The congregation usually numbers between 15 and 30 people.
